Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.progress

Interface Progress

All Known Implementing Classes:
CliProgress
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface Progress
Simple functional interface for handling progress updates.
Author:
Benjamin Lawry (bjlawry@sandia.gov) created on 09/02/2022

  • Method Details

    • update

      void update(int done, int total, String msg)
      Parameters:
      done - work done so far
      total - total work steps
      msg - optional message (null permitted)

    • update

      default void update(int done, int total)
      Convenience method, has same effect as calling update(done,total,null);
      Parameters:
      done - work done so far
      total - total work steps

    • withMessageGenerator

      default Progress withMessageGenerator(Supplier<String> generator)
      Parameters:
      generator -
      Returns:
      a Progress instance where all String messages are supplied by the specified generator

    • withMessageGenerator

      default Progress withMessageGenerator(BiFunction<Integer,Integer,String> generator)
      Parameters:
      generator -
      Returns:
      a Progress instance where the generator uses "done" and "total" to produce the String message.

    • aggregate

      static Progress aggregate(Collection<Progress> c)
      Combines all of the Progress instances in the specified Collection into one.
      Parameters:
      c - collection of Progress instances to aggregate
      Returns:
      single, combined Progress interface

    • aggregate

      static Progress aggregate(Progress... p)
      Combines all of the Progress instances in the specified array into one.
      Parameters:
      c - collection of Progress instances to aggregate
      Returns:
      single, combined Progress interface
